author: sharkhuh
content: The Goerli announcement for their merge is slated for the 6th-12th, but when exactly are the devs aiming for it ideally? As of now, https://bordel.wtf/ estimates it will hit on the 12th. Are we expecting to ramp up the hash power to have it happen earlier?

author: abcoathup
content:
Goerli testnet pre-merge is Proof of Authority and not Proof of Work so can't ramp up the hash power.

From the announcement: https://blog.ethereum.org/2022/07/27/goerli-prater-merge-announcement/
> The volatility in incremental difficulty per block makes estimating a window for the TTD harder than with a block or epoch height, hence the wider expected range. Users should note that this will also be the case for mainnet‚Äôs transition due to changes in proof-of-work hash rate.

author: ajsutton
content: In true merge style, it'll happen when it happens.

author: ajsutton
content: No idea if it's right or wrong, I don't think we've ever tried to estimate G√∂rli TD progress before really. We'll see I guess.

author: ajsutton
content: If it winds up being out by too much we can adjust the target TTD but we'll try to avoid that as it requires everyone to reconfigure their nodes and is likely to cause more problems.

author: ajsutton
content: This is the same on MainNet really - we won't be able to predict perfectly (though it is easier than with G√∂rli in many ways) and will just have to watch and wait.

author: sharkhuh
content: right, but on mainnet, it is PoW, and we can see progress on the TTD and the hashrate is a bit more predictable (short of some miner shenanigans)

author: ajsutton
content: G√∂rli has well defined rules for how the TD will increase - 1 for every block produced by an out of turn validator, 2 for those produced by an in-turn validator. But Mainnet hashrate can vary quite a bit too depending on whether miners start dropping off early or not, the DAG increase potentially bricking a bunch of lower memory cards etc.

author: ajsutton
content: So in both cases, we can compute a likely range and then watch and see what happens.

author: sharkhuh
content: is there a place where I can see the current TTD Goerli has reached so far?

author: ajsutton
content: TTD = terminal total difficulty, that's the config option specified in clients for when to switch to PoS.  You want to track the TD (total difficulty) which is shown for every block in etherscan just like for MainNet

author: yorickdowne
content: And is also tracked on bordel.wtf
